sitemap.severity: CRITICAL - Every blog article appears twice in sitemap (once under /blog/ and once under hub path). 44 duplicate pairs out of 113 total URLs means ~39% of sitemap is duplicated content.

homepage_schema.search_action_issue: Points to ?s= query parameter search which does not exist on this static Next.js site. Will result in showing homepage for any search.
issues: sameAs array is empty - should include LinkedIn, Twitter/X, GitHub profiles
SearchAction points to non-functional search endpoint (static site has no search)
WebPage URL in schema always shows homepage URL even on subpages (same schema used globally)

canonical_tag_summary.pattern: Pages with their own generateMetadata() in their page.tsx have correct canonicals. Pages that fall back to the root layout's default metadata get homepage canonical.
canonical_tag_summary.severity: CRITICAL - Most pages tell Google they are the homepage

additional_findings.www_redirect: Site serves on both bknddevelopment.com and www.bknddevelopment.com (browser auto-redirects to www but canonical uses non-www). This is fine as long as Vercel handles the redirect.
additional_findings.about_page_metadata: About page uses default homepage title/description - has no page-specific metadata at all
additional_findings.blog_listing_page: Blog listing (/blog/) has title 'Insights | BKND Development' but canonical points to homepage
additional_findings.og_image: Most pages use the same generic logo image for og:image instead of page-specific images

priority_fixes.issue: Canonical tags pointing to homepage on most pages
priority_fixes.impact: CRITICAL - Google treats all these pages as duplicates of homepage, destroying indexing
priority_fixes.fix: Add proper canonical URLs in generateMetadata() for every page, or fix the root layout default canonical to use the actual page path

priority_fixes.issue: 44 duplicate blog/hub article pairs in sitemap with no canonical differentiation
priority_fixes.impact: CRITICAL - Splits ranking signals across duplicate URLs
priority_fixes.fix: Either add canonical from hub articles pointing to /blog/ versions (or vice versa), or remove duplicates from sitemap and set up redirects

priority_fixes.issue: Old GitHub Pages domain (charwinvanryckdegroot.github.io/bknd-website) in JSON-LD schemas and OG tags on 5+ service pages
priority_fixes.impact: HIGH - Confuses search engines about site identity and domain authority
priority_fixes.fix: Replace all charwinvanryckdegroot.github.io/bknd-website references with bknddevelopment.com in service page components

priority_fixes.issue: Navigation broken on non-homepage pages (anchor links to #services, #resources, #industries, #contact)
priority_fixes.impact: HIGH - Poor UX and broken internal linking on all subpages
priority_fixes.fix: Change anchor links to proper page links (e.g., /#services or /services/) or make them smart links that prepend / when not on homepage

priority_fixes.issue: /services/ai/ page has no unique metadata at all
priority_fixes.impact: HIGH - Treated as duplicate of homepage by Google
priority_fixes.fix: Add generateMetadata() with proper title, description, canonical, and Service schema

priority_fixes.issue: Empty sameAs in Organization schema and non-functional SearchAction
priority_fixes.impact: MEDIUM - Missing authority signals and misleading structured data
priority_fixes.fix: Populate sameAs with LinkedIn URL and remove or fix SearchAction

priority_fixes.issue: No content hub links in footer
priority_fixes.impact: MEDIUM - Missing internal linking opportunity for hub pages
priority_fixes.fix: Add Resources section to footer with hub page links

priority_fixes.issue: Duplicate global schemas on hub pages (4 schemas instead of expected 2-3)
priority_fixes.impact: LOW-MEDIUM - Schema duplication wastes crawl budget and may confuse structured data parsing
priority_fixes.fix: Ensure global schema renders only once per page

summary: The BKND Development live site has several critical SEO issues that are likely suppressing search visibility. The most damaging problem is that canonical tags on the majority of pages (blog posts, hub pages, some service pages, about page) all point to the homepage, which tells Google every page is a duplicate of the homepage. Combined with 44 duplicate blog/hub article pairs in the sitemap (each article exists at both /blog/slug and /hub/slug with identical content and no canonical differentiation), this creates massive duplicate content signals. Additionally, 5+ service pages still reference the old GitHub Pages domain (charwinvanryckdegroot.github.io/bknd-website) in their JSON-LD schemas and OG tags, which confuses search engines about site identity. The /services/ai/ page has zero unique metadata and is essentially invisible as a distinct page to Google. Navigation anchor links (#services, #resources, etc.) are broken on all non-homepage pages. The Organization schema has an empty sameAs array (no social profiles) and a non-functional SearchAction pointing to a search endpoint that does not exist on this static site. Content hubs are not linked from the footer, missing a key internal linking opportunity.
